channel.title: Thoughts in aus
channel.description: It's like living n the past. We managed to consume ourinternet in like 2 days them had to get more. It's too hot to function it's constantly 25+, if anything needs to get done it takes forever. People take days off because, well why not it's sunny! (they genuinely take days off and just don't turn up if it's a nice day) there are more fast food places than I've ever seen before, it's horrendously americanised and they all can't drive, you only need to drive for 25 hours then you get awarded a license in WA and everyone drives automatics because they're gay. Also this is possibly the only place in the world I've been to where they hve signs directing you to places that dont exist yet, and they build roads and then just appear to give up on them and just start building another one

item.title: Thoughts in aus
item.dc:creator: @Phaze_One Fuscate
item.description:
@Phaze_One wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:90, topic:426262”]It takes some getting used to. I can’t speak for the rest of the country, but this summer has been extremely cool so far in NSW. Cool to the point that it doesn’t even feel right calling it summer.

With that said, I’d probably moan a lot about the cold if I went overseas to America or Europe for the winter, so I won’t pick on you too much. :P[/quote]

Same for us on the western side. Until recently the days haven’t peaked 35 degrees and Christmas was actually bearable to stay outside for the entire day for once.

Read full topic

item.title: Thoughts in aus
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

The average temperature in the UK this year was 9.62c, and it’s been our second warmest year on record (average).

I wonder what that is like in comparison Australia…

Read full topic

item.title: Thoughts in aus
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

It takes some getting used to. I can’t speak for the rest of the country, but this summer has been extremely cool so far in NSW. Cool to the point that it doesn’t even feel right calling it summer.

With that said, I’d probably moan a lot about the cold if I went overseas to America or Europe for the winter, so I won’t pick on you too much.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

Yeah there’s loads to see but I cant hack your climate, also we saw loads in WA
In other news, I’m home!!!

Read full topic

item.title: Thoughts in aus
item.dc:creator: @MujaheD Radeon
item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

I’m sorry to say but you just wasted a great opportunity to see things not everyone has the chance to do.

I uploaded some photos from my phone which have only been taken within the past month…















There is so much to see here in Australia, unless you’re not the outdoor type of person.

Read full topic

i take off in 7 hours, fucking excited! eugh so cannot wait to get home

Glad you enjoyed your stay.

item.title: Thoughts in aus
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“maminerr, post:83, topic:426262”][quote author=t4 link=topic=528953.msg3865865#msg3865865 date=1325003984]
They go to that effort? Impressive. Here in the US you can just hand them the log and they’ll flip through it in < 30s and say y/n.
[/quote]

And what age can you drive alone in the US?
I feel as if Australians have a better hope of not having an accident :P[/quote]
Uhm, it depends on what state - it’s normally around 16; though, some hick states have it set to 14.

As for accidents, I think it really depends on the driver/culture. I’ve never had an accident, neither has any of my closest friends or girlfriend - it’s not like I’m a granny driver either; I love going > 160 Kph on major highways during dead hours. I’ve heard of a few accidents happen from some colleagues, however most of them weren’t paying attention or they’re just plain retarded to begin with.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

[quote=“maminerr, post:83, topic:426262”][quote author=t4 link=topic=528953.msg3865865#msg3865865 date=1325003984]
They go to that effort? Impressive. Here in the US you can just hand them the log and they’ll flip through it in < 30s and say y/n.
[/quote]

And what age can you drive alone in the US?
I feel as if Australians have a better hope of not having an accident :P[/quote]

Technically 16 if you jump on it as fast as possible… Although no minors allowed for a year unless you have a licensed driver over 25 in the vehicle as well

Read full topic

item.title: Thoughts in aus
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“maminerr, post:75, topic:426262”][quote author=t4 link=topic=528953.msg3864618#msg3864618 date=1324918855]

How strict are they with the logs (assuming you don’t wave them for $40 after 2 years)?

In Queensland you get your learners permit at 16, and you have to complete 100 log book hours, some of which must be with a driving instructor which are worth 3 hours for every 1 hour, and 10 hours night driving. If you complete those hours in the first year you can go for your P1 license at 17. Victoria is much the same just you can go for your P1 at 18 after doing 120 hours and you have to take a hazards test. In Victoria you get your permit for 10 years, in Queensland a learners permit is 3 years and a P1 is an optional up to 5 years.
You can also apply for an exemption of years too in Queensland, and wave them the $40 earlier

But what I’m saying is: can’t you just forge it?
[/quote]

You can but they cross check the hours and dates with other log books and the weather and what not. You have to have the book approved before you can book your test.[/quote]
They go to that effort? Impressive. Here in the US you can just hand them the log and they’ll flip through it in < 30s and say y/n.

[quote=“Radeon, post:81, topic:426262”][quote author=sanga282 link=topic=528953.msg3865759#msg3865759 date=1324996196]

So yeah erm got sunstroke so eating hasnt been great, not a fan of this, but its 2 days and a few hours till i leave perth airports tarmac so im getting there

Perth is a shit state anyway, hence your shit time. Should have gone to Sydney, Queensland or Victoria.

to visit my other 3 pairs of parents that just happen to reside within those places…
[/quote]

Wtf how do you have 3 parents???[/quote]
Definitely not sarcasm.

Read full topic

Friend got smacked at 70 on the M3 last year. He was pissed out his face and just had an argument with someone. Was put in ICU for like 7 months.

item.title: Thoughts in aus
item.dc:creator: @maminerr maminerr
item.description:
@maminerr wrote:

[quote=“t4, post:64, topic:426262”][quote author=maminerr link=topic=528953.msg3864500#msg3864500 date=1324906429]

How strict are they with the logs (assuming you don’t wave them for $40 after 2 years)?

In Queensland you get your learners permit at 16, and you have to complete 100 log book hours, some of which must be with a driving instructor which are worth 3 hours for every 1 hour, and 10 hours night driving. If you complete those hours in the first year you can go for your P1 license at 17. Victoria is much the same just you can go for your P1 at 18 after doing 120 hours and you have to take a hazards test. In Victoria you get your permit for 10 years, in Queensland a learners permit is 3 years and a P1 is an optional up to 5 years.
You can also apply for an exemption of years too in Queensland, and wave them the $40 earlier
[/quote]
But what I’m saying is: can’t you just forge it?[/quote]

You can but they cross check the hours and dates with other log books and the weather and what not. You have to have the book approved before you can book your test.

Read full topic

item.title: Thoughts in aus
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

true, but i still think a car crash at 70mph is pretty tame (or, well, not tame, but yknow what i mean… nothing close to “probably gonna die”)

tL: weird, ok then. the one i saw, when the car was going 30 he didnt hit the other person at all

Read full topic

item.title: Thoughts in aus
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:70, topic:426262”][quote author=sanga282 link=topic=528953.msg3864949#msg3864949 date=1324937478]
I think with regards to the motorway limit though it’s pretty irrelevant. A you shouldn’t be there B you’ll probably die at 70 anyway. I know you mean the 40 in a 30 zone ads though
[/quote]

the point is the increased reaction travel time and braking time at higher speeds i think, not how likely you are to die if you hit something

besides, im not sure “probably die at 70” is accurate, ive come off bikes at close to that chances of surviving at 70 in a car must be pretty high[/quote]
itt that cuz you were on a bike you probably didnt collide with something so you probably slid across the floor at like 70 miles an hour right? with leathers on yeah that’d definitely not tickle but its a lot less strenuous on a body than a collision

Read full topic

item.title: Thoughts in aus
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

The point of those ads was if you hit someone at 30, they’re more likely to survive than if you hit them at 40.

item.title: Thoughts in aus
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

sanga282:

I think with regards to the motorway limit though it’s pretty irrelevant. A you shouldn’t be there B you’ll probably die at 70 anyway. I know you mean the 40 in a 30 zone ads though

the point is the increased reaction travel time and braking time at higher speeds i think, not how likely you are to die if you hit something

besides, im not sure “probably die at 70” is accurate, ive come off bikes at close to that chances of surviving at 70 in a car must be pretty high

item.title: Thoughts in aus
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:68, topic:426262”]It has been similar ads in Norway, the main point wasn’t less damage, but more time to stop if something happened.

But why does this really matters to you? You are at least allowed to drive killing machines in insane high speeds.[/quote]
needs more speed ! i regularly belted my old motor down the m1 at over 100
Also: more australia news, fed some kangaroos and touched a koala, they are really soft! koalas are the laziest mother fuckers in the world though, sleeping for 20 hours a day and eating for the reamining 4, its immense. Erm went sandboarding too, saw a lobster fishing buildingy place thing. still excited to leave this place though, its too hot and not the sort of place i want to come for a holiday.

Read full topic
